meanings.definition: To ring a bell slowly and repeatedly
meanings.sent1: The church bells were tolling for the evening service.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the tolling of the bell from afar.
meanings.sent3: The tolling of the bell seemed to lull the entire village to sleep.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the tolling of the bell echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The tolling of the bell marked the end of another day.

meanings.definition: To charge a fee or tax
meanings.sent1: The city started tolling vehicles entering the downtown area.
meanings.sent2: The government decided to toll all vehicles passing through the highway.
meanings.sent3: I never expected them to toll us for using the public restroom!
meanings.sent4: The hotel began tolling guests for late check-outs.
meanings.sent5: The amusement park started tolling visitors for parking.

meanings.definition: To cause (a bell) to ring with a slow, repeated sound
meanings.sent1: He carefully tolls the bell to announce the end of the day.
meanings.sent2: The old clock tower tolls every hour.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids decided to toll the school bell early.
meanings.sent4: The wind gently tolls the bells in the abandoned church.
meanings.sent5: The tolling of the bell can be heard throughout the quiet town.
